alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 11:46PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .A cluster of strong thunderstorms occurred over the Miles City area about an hour ago. Over an inch of rain has been observed so far (1.33" at Miles City Airport as of 1050 PM), likely leading to minor flooding of poor drainages. While no additional, heavy rain is expected, minor flooding impacts may continue for the next 1-2 hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Until 130 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain occurred due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miles City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
